Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2012 08:03AM cthynsh wrote: Hi Ladies - I am 10 days post BMX with TE.  My PS provided me with something I have not seen mentioned on these boards and it was a game changer!  I numbing agent in a fanny pouch call "On-Q".  It numbed the surgical area for the first week.  I made it thru without any pain meds other than a tylenol every once in a while.  It required two tiny guidewires that kept a constant drip of numbing agent thru the breasts.  On my followup visit, 2 of my four drains were removed as well as the On-Q.  The hardest part physically of all of this was the anesthesia.  Made me so very sick.  I am still feeling the side effects but not much pain!  Did anyone else get the "pain pouch"? Wishing health and healing to all
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2012 04:02PM cthynsh wrote: GA_chicken2012 - the dye injection is not that bad...more of a burning sensation.  Mine was near the nipple and the doctor told me to hold my breath and count to 20. I heard tey can't use lidocaine because it inhibits the travel of the dye.  You will rock this!  One less thing to worry about.

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2012 05:28PM cthynsh wrote: Hi All - I'm coming over from the Sept. 2012 Surgery Group.  I have a Lumpectomy with SNB on Sept. 13 but pathology showed the cancer was more aggressive than originally thought.  So here I am waiting for my October BMX.  Scheduled for the 23rd but hoping something sooner opens up.  I have LVI (lymphovascular invasion).  Anyone else?  I wish everyone a speedy recovery.  Its great to have support like this.  Peace to All
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2012 02:30PM cthynsh wrote: nycmom3 - Kids are pretty smart, especially 11 year old girls!  I have one of those and a 14 year old son.  We were open with them from pretty much the moment I found out.  My daughter is awesome...wants to know everything.  They have seen me thru my lumpectomy (Sept 13) and now we are heading to BMX (Oct 23).  I believe (just my opinion) that the more open, the better they will deal.  I think kids can sense when something is going on and that makes them more nervous when they arent sure what it could be.  Hardest words to say..."Mommy has cancer".  But once its said, its a bit of a relief. Hugs to you on this rocky journey.  Cancer Sucks!! Cathy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene
